skill.name: write-plan
skill.tagline: Create detailed, structured plans for code changes with clear tasks and verification steps
skill.summary: The write-plan skill helps you create comprehensive development plans for codebase changes. It structures your work into clear tasks, identifies what needs human verification, and ensures thorough testing. This skill is designed for users who need systematic guidance when making changes to unfamiliar codebases.

workflow.mermaid:
graph TD
    A[Start: Announce skill use] --> B[Analyze requirements and context]
    B --> C[Create plan using template]
    C --> D[Define tasks with dependencies]
    D --> E[Add required sections]
    E --> F[Identify hypotheses]
    F --> G[Mark human verification needs]
    G --> H[Plan ready for execution]

steps.name: Skill Announcement
steps.description: The skill announces it's being used to create a plan

steps.name: Context Analysis
steps.description: Analyzes the codebase and requirements assuming zero user context

steps.name: Template Application
steps.description: Creates a structured plan using the mandatory template format

steps.name: Task Definition
steps.description: Breaks work into specific, manageable tasks with clear dependencies

steps.name: Section Completion
steps.description: Adds required sections like project structure, testing, and architecture when relevant

steps.name: Hypothesis Identification
steps.description: Marks assumptions that need validation before proceeding

steps.name: Verification Planning
steps.description: Identifies what needs human verification and prioritizes those tasks

principles: Always use exact file paths and complete code in plans
Break big tasks into smaller, focused ones for better context management
Identify and validate hypotheses before making conclusions
Prioritize human verification tasks at the start of the plan
Use specific templates for different plan components (structure, testing, etc.)
Document everything assuming the user has zero context for the codebase
